values:
7 weeks of the first semester are down.  35 days of school in the books.  Many memorable moments have already been made.  

Let's start off with band camp.  We get together the wednesday before classes start and make music and get to know each other.  I am fairly certain i met every single rookie and attempted to make small talk with them as well.  On top of meeting some great people, and being more extroverted than i had been the previous two years, espn the magazine came and did a GREAT job with an article about the marching virginians.  If you ever want to see it, let me know, i have a copy or two!  Classes then start and things are great.  

Our first game ws on September 1 against ECU.  It wasn't pretty, but pregame was excellent and we came out on top.  The following thursday, a small band known as the Dave Matthews Band came and gave us some free music.  He brought Phil Vassar, Nas, and John Mayer.  Excellent.  I bought a second ticket for a friend that i hadn't even seen all summer because of this and that, and when i finally got word on getting that second ticket, she was unable to ask off of work.  bummer.  Saturday, september 8.  VT at LSU.  i made 7 layer bean dip, gene made french onion dip, and greg made beef and cheese dip, we had a ton of people over, and we all consoled each other as the hokies got crushed by the tigers.  It's cool though.  

fast forward to after game 6 and we are now 5 and 1, and one game away from being bowl eligible again!  Lots of questions to be asked yet of this football team, but there are several games left down the road that may just answer those questions.  this past weekend i went to clemson with my cousin and two of his friends.  earlier in the semester i stated i would hang out with another good friend of mine, and after committing towards buying the ticket, was reminded that clemson weekend was the same time that friend would be in.  I really apologize to that friend.  It was totally my fault, but i have a feeling they may have done the same if there was a bigger game for their respective school, and just because i was gone for saturday doesn't mean i wasn't available sunday afternoon and monday all day, even for lunch or something.  

back to the trip.  it was great.  brian picked me up at around 730 on saturday morning and the 4 of us crammed in his honda civic and road 5 hours to clemson.  we ended up tailgating with a girl from roanoke who is now at clemson, her parents and friends, and some other hokies too.  Obviously the game was great.  Beamerball was on top of things as we scored 17 in the first quarter, and 31 in the first half...leading up to a total of 41 for the game.  While we were in the nosebleed section, it was the hokie section and we were fortunate enough to be one row directly behind three other college-aged hokie fans (girls!!).  Two go to Tech and the other goes to Radford.  I definitely had a blast during the game being a fan and hanging out with awesome people in my cousin and the girls.  it makes me think more about what i want to do next year.  do i want to be a fan or be in the band?  i can't help but stop and remind myself that I have set goals in marching band that i have not yet achieved.  I want to obtain those goals, and the only way to do so is to stick it out for the last year.  i loved this road trip, but eyes on the prize...

Now my token girl section.
Freshman.  Trumpet/Music Major.  Blonde.  Goofball.  What else can I ask for in a girl?  We clicked from pretty much day one.  Turns out through auditions i sit next to her in wind ensemble too.  I haven't looked too hard for a girl in college, because i haven't cared to date while in college yet.  Then she came along.  I couldn't sit back and watch THIS one get by like i may have in the past.  I jumped on it and asked her for a date.  i kind of got the hint that maybe i was a bit fast in asking about dating, so we agreed that we should hang out with the potential of dating.  At least she knows matt bartley is interested in her.  That was where i stood as of september 14.  The next third of the story goes until october 1.  between the 14th and the 1st we have not hung out ONCE.  turns out i ask people for their time at in-opportune times.  Always when she was too tired or too busy with homework.  Then last week, october 1, someone shared gossip with me.  I hear rumors that she pulled an all nighter with someone, and i don't mean studying.  i don't want to jump on anything too soon but If she goes for a guy that enjoys 40 races and being a big bag of douche, i am ready to drop her like a bad habit.  if she has no morals, there's no way i want to associate myself with her.  i've been told that down the road they figure out what's right and what's not.  until then, if that's the kind of girl she is, i'm not going to give her my time.  the problem is: how do you figure out if that's more than just gossip?  isn't it kind of weird asking someone about that???  i just dont' know...

haha so about every 6 months i write a mile-long journal.  hope you enjoy.  i'm very open for input!!

Before I start, this is a disclaimer to everyone whose home for the summer was larger than a 60 mile radius of roanoke. I am not pointing fingers at you. You are not included in this. sometimes distance is a separating factor that becomes harder to overcome than even i realized. i deeply apologize to anyone who has already read this and took it differently than i intended, but appreciate and respect her concern, and thank her for the wake up call that required me to write this as a disclaimer.  this was also written, copied and pasted from a few days ago, so since i the summer went by so fast anyways, you guys who graciously slipped in time for me are not included as well.


You know what grinds my gears? When people make commitments and don't follow through with them. For example:
"I will call you this week"
"We will DEFINITELY hang out this week"
"We will hang out as soon as things settle down, I promise"
"we'll get together, I promise"
"I'll give you a call tomorrow"
I believe the point is getting across. If not, then you are totally ignorant. These are all direct quotes from multiple people over the summer time. You'd be surprised at how many people promised they would make time and those who actually followed through with it. A big thanks to Rachel Stidham (for making maggie moo's plans and not backing out on me for a movie) and Sarah Houff (Willy Wonka!!! haha) for that. But here's the deal, if you don't want to hang out, can't find time, don't lead someone on by saying you will! It's not fair to that person. Especially the busy excuse. I apologize that my summer job had a regular schedule and i was available nearly EVERY weeknight this summer, and that after a few times of contact I backed off and gave you space, so as not to be irritating. I think my dad put it best when he said "you realize who your real friends are by the end of the summer". well guess what friends? After tonight I have two more nights in vinton. what are you going to do about it? nothing. thanks for being the wonderful loyal friends i've always wanted. i'm glad that high school, and even middle school created lasting memories between us that we can hang out so much while we're home from college. i'm about 2 more sparks from being able to burn the bridges between me and some people so i never have to look back. fortunately i'm a forgiving person, but i can never forget how many times i had been left in the dust this summer.

let me also say that i am NOT mad at anyone, i'm upset with actions. while i'm saying this, i also want to point out i am even less disturbed by the ones who never promised a call or plans to begin with. you have been the most honest. promises are coupled with dependability. if you are not dependable, don't make promises.

in a series/league whatever you want to call it, jeff gordon has really achieved the unattainable.  with the win today, he has passed one of the greatest drivers in nascar, dale earnhardt,  for career wins(77).  nascar in its earlier years was a league that had maybe 3 or 4 drivers that were real competitors.  now the competition has become MUCH more leveled, and there are many more drivers capable of winning week in and week out. Jeff also has more than twice as many wins as anyone else on the circuit (Rusty Wallace, 34), and is second place to Darrell Waltrip (84) in the modern cup era(1972).  love him or hate him, it will be hard to find another driver in the future of nascar as dominant as jeff gordon.

i don't know.  i feel like it happens almost every year.  i just feel like right now, there aren't many people in my life that would truly consider me a friend.  i expected to see and hang out with way more people over break.  not including the bowl trip and the wedding i went to, i hung out with two people more than once and felt like an actual contribution and a reason that hanging out was possible.  how come people are fine with bringing me along with a big group, yet when i mention a one on one or just a few people kinda opportunity, people freeze and never get back to me.  what am i doing (or not doing).  so at home, like i said, it's been two people.  thanks a LOT to those two.  you mean a lot to me and you both always have.  

what about my college friends?  i don't know.  at all.    thanks to the stalking ability of facebook, my "group" at college found a weekend to get together at one of their houses and hang out.  everyone that i have dedicated easily at least 95% of my time to was there.  not including peyden and justin, there isn't anyone at tech even CLOSE to these guys.  and it's not that i feel like i am the most disconnected of the group that was there either, because i don't believe that's true at all.  i know i shouldn't complain, and it's not that i'm asking for people to leave me comments saying "well i love you", because it's far from it.  i just hope someone will hear me out i guess.  maybe my purpose is that if you see this, i am geniunely bothered and for you guys to know it.  

not saying i'm not friends with you guys and that anything has been hurt because of what you did.  it's a two way thing and i know i haven't held up to my half of many friendships over break either, but i feel like i have worked hard enough and gone enough out of my way in the past year to at least be included on the get together.

maybe i should just get a job and not have time for friends.  that way i can spend all the money i want on my car and maybe pay off a few dollars of the large debts i'll have when i leave college

on the positive side.  this is the first woe is me journal i have posted on livejournal that isn't about the generic girl that i am crazy about that only sees me as a friend.  i still haven't found a girl that i consider "date-able" that would give me the time of day, but apparently that should be the least of my worries at the moment anyways

Idea of a Friend


In kindergarten your idea of a good friend was the person who let you have the red crayon when all that was left was the ugly black one. 

In first grade your idea of a good friend was the person who went to the bathroom with you and held your hand as you walked through the scary halls. 

In second grade your idea of a good friend was the person who helped you stand up to the class bully. 

In third grade your idea of a good friend was the person who shared their lunch with you when you forgot yours on the bus. 

In fourth grade your idea of a good friend was the person who was willing to switch square dancing partners in gym so you wouldn't have to be stuck do-si-do-ing with Nasty Nicky or Smelly Susan. 

In fifth grade your idea of a friend was the person who saved a seat on the back of the bus for you. 

In sixth grade your idea of a friend was the person who went up to Nick or Susan, your new crush, and asked them to dance with you, so that if they said no you wouldn't have to be embarrassed. 

In seventh grade your idea of a friend was the person who let you copy the social studies homework from the night before that you had. 

In eighth grade your idea of a good friend was the person who helped you pack up your stuffed animals and old baseball cards so that your room would be a "high schooler's" room, but didn't laugh at you when you finished and broke out into tears. 

In ninth grade your idea of a good friend was the person who went to that "cool" party thrown by a senior so you wouldn't wind up being the only freshman there. 

In tenth grade your idea of a good friend was the person who changed their schedule so you would have someone to sit with at lunch. 

In eleventh grade your idea of a good friend was the person who gave you rides in their new car, convinced your parents that you shouldn't be grounded, consoled you when you broke up with Nick or Susan, and found you a date to the prom. 

In twelfth grade your idea of a good friend was the person who helped you pick out a college, assured you that you would get into that college, helped you deal with your parents who were having a hard time adjusting to the idea of letting you go. 

At graduation your idea of a good friend was the person who was crying on the inside but managed the biggest smile one could give as they congratulated you. 

The summer after twelfth grade your idea of a good friend was the person who helped you clean up the bottles from that party, helped you sneak out of the house when you just couldn't deal with your parents, assured you that now that you and Nick or you and Susan were back together, you could make it through anything, helped you pack up for college and just silently hugged you as you looked through blurry eyes at 18 years of memories you were leaving
behind, and finally on those last days of childhood, went out of their way to come over and send you off with a hug, a lot of memories, reassurance that you would make it in college as well as you had these past 18 years, and most importantly sent you off to college knowing you were loved. 

Now, your idea of a good friend is still the person who gives you the better of the two choices, holds your hand when you're scared, helps you fight off those who try to take advantage of you, thinks of you at times when you are not there, reminds you of what you have forgotten, helps you put the past behind you but understands when you need to hold on to it a little longer, stays with you so that you have confidence, goes out of their way to make time for you, helps you clear up your mistakes, helps you deal with pressure from others, smiles for you when they are sad, helps you become a better person, and most importantly loves you!

so thank you to all of those who have been a friend to me in any stage of my life...like the person i got this from said, people come into your life, make their mark on it, and leave...i want to keep in touch with as many of those people as possible, but i will never forget any of them

okay well prom was really cool...i went with someone from northside and had a great time...i don't know if i can say the same for her cuz i suck at this kinda thing since i am a shy kid at talking and i'm not that big on dancing...but i still had fun and i just want her to know how thankful i am that she went with me!!

now the band trip was only like 4 days after prom...so already on not enough sleep, we left on wednesday night at 9 and went all the way thru the night
  we ate at burger king on thurs morning and then made it to gainesville and the univ. of florida where we had a music clinic with danny galyen, who used to teach at northside and is the oldest of the 3 galyens...then we ate and hung out there and left for cocoa beach not long after...we made it there and to holiday inn, unpacked and then went to some family fun center with go-carts, putt-putt, rock climbing, and an arcade...that was fun...my dad's cousin who lives in florida came and talked to me and my rents while we were there...then we went back to the hotel and hung out on the beach but it was dark so we just kinda stood there...well everyone left but a few and to make a long story shorter, a chaparone accused me of taking pics of 2 of the chicks topless w/ my digital cam...but i didn't take any pics and they weren't topless...but she told mrs c and my dad and i got my cam taken away for the night and they took the chicks' cams to get them developed soon...that story will be continued later

now i'm not a big advocate of talking about things/people...but first off i'm glad i'll never have to see that god-awful chaparone lady again!  that was the only hint of drama and it involved a chaparone...how wrong!  but then there were several couples that got together/are much much closer and i have to admit that one makes me a bit jealous but life goes on...i wish you all that got together on a band trip hook-up the best haha...

but now back to school and only 2 more regular days then exams start and i only have to take one exam and i get out early on friday...on fri. night i plan on seeing my buds at lb graduate and then on saturday i'm going to the wakeboarding festival at smith mtn lake...i was gonna be in it but i haven't wakeboarded at all this year so not a good idea haha...but umm i guess that's about it soo i'll be talking to y'all later!!

yeah well what's shakin you guys?  what it's been like a week and a half right?  yeah well these past few weeks have definately been better ones for me...they have been busy, but very fun...we did our first week of easter pageant performance last week (wed-fri all at 7, sat 2 and 7, sun 7) and i had to show up like an hour and a half early for make-up and notes and just hanging out and getting ready and such so not much of an afternoon, but i got to be with some really cool people so not a problem.  well actually yeah a problem.  there's one person in the youth group that's in the easter pageant and thinks it's fun to point out everything i do that's funny to her and laugh about it...usually not a problem, but first you have to hear and see her laugh (VERY loud and VERY dramatic) and then you have to count how many times it happened (a few times a night, a few times too much), then you have to add the parts when it's mentioned and laughed about later (each time i do something she laughs at)...so i didn't appreciate that and it really takes me away from the main reason i'm in the easter pageant so hopefully this won't happen during the last 4 performances we have cuz it's taken all that i have in me not to go off...but neways...

sunday was very busy...had church till 1130 then of course we got out later and ya never get out of the parking lot at 1130 lol but i had to be at calvary baptist (downtown) at 1230 so i had mcdonald's on the way there and rehearsed...then i went straight to youth symphony which started at 2 and lasted till 5 then went straight back to my church for the performance...fun stuff..VERY BUSY...now during all of this i was catching a cold too...so not feeling very good!

monday-tuesday stayed at home, watched lots of tv (Ray is a good movie, so is Out Cold) and on monday on the price is right, both contestants over-bid(ed?) on the final showcase so neither one won...made me mad lol but yeah i went to see doc this morning who told me to keep takin the over-the-counters stuff i've been takin and i'll be good...and came back for physics and statistics...missed the fire yesterday!  then had a dentist appt today at 4 where i got 2 fillings and that wasn't fun...the novocaine needle caught my tongue and numbed that so i had a problem eating dinner...then i just kinda hung out after dinner, played my trumpet for the first time since sunday(never doing that again) and still had problems playing it cuz i can't stop coughing! but it'll get better...i hope...
